entry.title: How-to call SuccessFactors LMS API to get Learning History of an employee from SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
The requirement is to read the records with COMPLETED status of the trainings of an employee from SuccessFactors LMS using ODATA V4 API as specified over SAP documentation for Odata APIs https://help.sap.com/doc/cd753f29622244df98e335af737b5422/2505/en-US/SF_LRN_Web_Svc_Integ.pdf

Pager 494 has the information of GET query.

1. Which adapter should be used within Iflow of SAP integration suite.

2. How to add OAUTH credentials to secure store of SAP integration suite.

Please Share your thoughts.

Thanks

Veera

entry.title: Restrict the app F2175 Find Maintenance Order to show orders that an user is responsible for
entry.content:
Hello Everyone - I would like to restrict the orders displayed in the app, F2175 (Find Maintenance Order). I searched in SAP Community and could not find helpful information. Any pointers on how this can be achieved would be of great help.

Steps:

Access the app from launchpad

Clicking on the GO button should display only orders that I am responsible for.

I know we can do "Adapt Filters" and restrict on our personnel number. But this is a user specific setting. I want to restrict based on "Personnel Number" entered.

Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Use multiple services in XML annotation with Fiori ELements to implement a Value Help
entry.content:
Hello,

I have an XML annotation file where I want to define a Value Help using Common.ValueList. The Value Help is provided by a separate second service. 

To be able to use this second service, I'm trying to define a reference to this service (see below):

    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/MAIN_SERVICE/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="MAIN_SRV"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/VALUE_HELP_SERVICE/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="VALUE_HELP_SRV"/>
    </edmx:Reference>

However this gives me the following error message on the Namespace of VALUE_HELP_SRV:

 Unknown Namespace.
Namespace for the metadata must match the one defined in the metadata file: 'MAIN_SRV'.
Namespaces for vocabularies must match the namespace from the supported vocabularies, see User Guide.

 

SAP Fiori Elements OData

entry.title: Reported By doesn't show all users in Request Maintenance App (F1511)
entry.content:
Hello,

When we try to create a "Request Maintenance" using the Request Maintenance App (F1511), my user does not appear in the "Reported By" field. I do have a user account in the S/4HANA environment. We have tried creating an HR Master Record (PA30) and also set up a Business Partner (BP), but none of these steps have resolved the issue.

We are performing this validation in our development system as part of a new EAM project implementation. In the development environment, HR Master data is not synchronized with SuccessFactors, so we do not have access to all HR Master records. For this reason, we are attempting to create users manually.

Any guidance or pointers on how to resolve this would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Phani

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Do not display deleted line item in sap adobe form output using SAP S4 using Gateway service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am using SAP gateway service to develope SAP ADOBE form using the interface i want to omit the deleted line item in form output.

I am following the below steps to produce form output.

1. Create PO with 3 line items and save it.

2. Delete 1 line item from the PO and approve it using the Front End and corresponding output is generated in which i have omited    the deleted line item so the output contains 2 line items.

3. Now i change the PO after apprval and delete another line item this time for the change po i should get only the recently deleted line item in the Change PO output i.e only 2 line items.

Could you please let me know from which table in SAP S4 could i use to add logic.

entry.title: String was not recognized as valid DateTime error
entry.content:
Hi all,

We would like to post notifications (IW23) via a PowerAutomate.
Unfortunately, this only works if the browser language is English.

For example, in German we get the following error message:
"error": {
"code": 500,
"message": "BadGateway",
"innerError": {
"status": 500,
"error": {
"message": "String was not recognized as a valid DateTime."

Connection: SAP OData
API: /sap/opu/odata/sap/api_maintnotification/
OData Entity Name: MaintenanceNotification
Method: POST
RequiredEndDate: 2025-12-25T00:00:00Z

We have tried the following date Formats:
2025-12-25 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
20251225 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
25.12.2025 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
25-12-2025 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
2025.12.25 --> 400 BadRequest (CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME)
2025-12-25T00:00:00Z --> BadGateway

The error CX_SY_CONVERSION_NO_DATE_TIME should come from /IWCOR/CL_DS_EDM_DATE_TIME====CM004. The date is expected here as follows --> ISO-8601 format:
FIND REGEX `^([[[:digit:]]{1,4})-([[:digit:]]{1,2})-([[:digit:]]{1,2})T(([[:digit:]]{1,2}):([[:digit:]]{1,2})(? ::([[:digit:]]{1,2})(\.[[:digit:]]{1,7})?)?$` "#EC NOTEXT
IN iv_timestamp
SUBMATCHES lv_year lv_month lv_day lv_hour lv_minute lv_second lv_fracs.

What is the problem here?
In which format must the date be transmitted?

Best regards,
Marco

entry.title: Implementing "Add Card to Insights" in a Fiori Elements List Report Application
entry.content:
I am trying to implement the Add Card to Insights feature in my Fiori Elements List Report application but have encountered issues. Below is an overview of my application and the problem:

  • Type: Fiori Elements App (based on sap.fe.core.fpm)
  • OData Version: V4 with List Report
  • Customization:
    • Explicitly declared Variant Management in the XML view since it wasn't supported via the manifest.
    • Extended with a Custom XML View + Controller.

I want to enable the Add Card to Insights functionality for my List Report table. I attempted to configure this using the following controlConfiguration in my manifest.json:

"controlConfiguration": {
  "@com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.LineItem": {
    "tableSettings": {
      "type": "ResponsiveTable",
      "enableAddCardToInsights": true
    }
  }
}

 

However, this configuration did not work.

then

I manually called a POST request to the INSIGHTS_CARDS endpoint with dummy data for a card. The response indicated: "message": "Insights is inactive" with error code /UI2/INSIGHTS_MSG/008.

but
I'm getting XML response when i try to access this below metadata

/sap/opu/odata4/ui2/insights_srv/srvd/ui2/insights_cards_read_srv/0001/INSIGHTS_CARDS$metadata

entry.title: No EP user in Integration Center Job Output
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We are using EmpEmployment entity in Integration Center Job (no filter is used) to extract data .It has come to our attention that contractors are not being included in the output of the IC job.

For contractors, only basic user import is performed, and no other data is available for contractors. Kindly clarify whether it is anticipated behavior to omit contractors from this job's output, and if so, could you please explain the rationale behind this?

 

Best Regards.

entry.title: Problem with ODATA /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT (/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027)
entry.content:
Good morning,

After activating the OData service /IWBEP/USERMANAGEMENT, I’m able to use the CurrentUser and UserCollection('UserName') endpoints successfully.

However, when I attempt to call UserCollection to retrieve all user entities, I receive the following error:

"code": "/IWBEP/CM_MGW_RT/027",
"message": {
   "lang": "en",
   "value": "Operation 'Query' not supported for entity type 'User'"
}

According to the service metadata, calling UserCollection should return all user entities.

Could you please confirm whether this issue is due to:

  • The UserCollection entity set not being implemented by SAP in this standard service, or

  • A misconfiguration on our application server side?

Have a nice day.

entry.title: Missing Post Processing for Odata Inteface - S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
I’m currently facing a challenge regarding interface design in the SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud environment.

My goal is to implement an interface that fulfills two key requirements:

  1. It must support post-processing and monitoring through the Application Interface Framework (AIF) in S/4HANA Public Cloud.
  2. It must provide an immediate response with clear error codes and messages, which can be forwarded to third-party systems.

    Unfortunately, I can’t achieve both at the same time with the current options. I’m forced to make a compromise:

    • With OData APIs, I do receive immediate error messages, which is ideal for integrating with third-party systems. However, OData interfaces do not support AIF, which means I lose important capabilities like system monitoring and post-processing.
    • On the other hand, asynchronous SOAP APIs are compatible with AIF and support post-processing and monitoring. But they don’t return immediate responses, making it hard to forward real-time errors to third-party systems.

      I’m working with business scenarios like Purchase Orders, Supplier Confirmations, Inbound Deliveries, and Supplier Invoices. Each of these either:

      • Offers OData APIs with no AIF support, or
      • Provides SOAP APIs, but only asynchronous ones without real-time feedback.

        At the moment, no matter which approach I choose—OData or SOAP—I seem to miss out on a crucial feature. Has anyone found a workaround or best practice to bridge this gap?

        Thank you!

        kind regards, 

        Philipp

entry.title: OData service API_CV_ATTACHMENT
entry.content:
We are consuming OData service API_CV_ATTACHMNET_SRV in S/4HANA.

What we recognize it just reads objects as GOS but not from D3/ArchiveLink. According to documentation the HDM has to activated (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/9f047b05da4545ca8f9ebfc22acefd06/2e1be0a60d08400b8e4b1f6b57140a28.html?locale=en-US. )

entry.title: Configure Post Odata Sender - Error 403
entry.content:
I need to create an Odata to update the data. I'm configuring the sender Odata adapter with Authorization = 'User Role' and Operation = 'Post'. I have deployed it, and when I try to invoke it and  I get a 403 errors.

I have invoked with Postman. I added a body and the following to the headers:

"Content-Type: application/json

Accept: application/json"

I created another GET and it works. Therefore, the problem is not the user I use to invoke it

entry.title: Smart table does not show CDS view results
entry.content:
I was trying to display the sales document number on my Smart Table using CDS views. However, it only shows blank. What are wrong with my code?

<smartTable:SmartTable
  id="Results"
  enableAutoBinding="true"
  editable="false"
>
<Table items="{/ZSD_C_SDOC}">
<columns>
 <Column>
  <Text text="Sales Document"/>
 </Column>
</columns>
<items>
 <ColumnListItem>
  <cells>
   <Text text="{SalesDocNo}"/>
  </cells>
 </ColumnListItem>
</items>
</Table>
</smartTable:SmartTable>

 

@odata.publish: true
@EndUserText.label: 'Test CDS View'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true

define root view ZSD_C_SDOC as select from vbak
{
 key vbeln as SalesDocNo
}
